column1: '''William "Bill" Cater''' is a British journalist who interviewed [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] on [[2 August]] [[1966]].<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond
column4: ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: Chronology''
column5: p. 671</ref> Cater later became a friend of Tolkien<ref>[http://www.lotrplaza.com/forum/forum_posts.asp?TID=224896 Tolkien - the most unmanageable man (January 11
column8: 2010</ref> and they exchanged several letters (see Letters [[Letter 322|322]]
column11: Cater made an interview with [[Christopher Tolkien]]

column1: In a 1972 article celebrating Tolkien's upcoming 80th birthday
column2: Cater coined a famous expression which was to be used on the dustwrappers of an edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'':

column1: {{quote|The English-speaking world is divided into those who have read The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings and those who are going to read them.|William Cater
At the [[J.R.R. Tolkien Centenary Conference]] in 1992
column2: [[Helen Armstrong]] presented the paper "How Dare You Call Me That! William Cater Interviewing Tolkien" (not submitted for publication).<ref>[http://www.tolkiensociety.org/1992/index.html Tolkien Centenary Conference] at Tolkiensociety.org
